reviews.review_msg: A 3-hour class that could have been downgraded to 1 hour. Lectures were honestly boring but the subjects we covered were insightful. Very sweet and genuine prof you can tell she wants to do well in the class. Assignments/ Tests were very broad it was hard to tell what she wanted but she wasn't tha hard of a marker. She's unclear about expectations

Her assignments are very unclear as well as her marking. She focuses less on what you wrote and more on how you wrote it. Her questions in the papers and midterm are so broad yet she wants specific answers - it doesn't make sense. Meeting with her before each assignment didn't help either - she's really nice and seems smart but not a good class.

A really kind Prof, but not for me. I get the sense she's a great researcher - but I didn't find her to be a very engaging prof. Tough grader & feedback was confusing - it was hard to figure out how to improve. Course was very structured & more detail than idea oriented. Focus on development was very narrow - was hoping to get more out the course.

Habiba is soooooo nice. You can tell she is very passionate about her work. You need to prepare a lot for the midterm because she gives you the questions in advance and in my opinion, they were super difficult and long. She marks hard on papers, but not on the midterm.

The class was easy, but meaning it was easy to learn. I felt like i learnt way more in her classes because it was so accessible. She is so kind and supportive. 100% reccomend! Shes so funny & badass despite being tiny haha Her accent is thick, and people complain, but honestly if you make an effort to listen it really isnt a problem at all.

Habiba is one of the most fantastic people I have ever met. Her classes are group work heavy which forces you socialize and interact might not sit well with introverts. Loved her! She is genuine with her care and love for her students. She honestly will do her best to see you succeed. Great content and interesting course. Habiba is awesome!!!!!!!!!

Habiba is one of the most caring people you'll ever meet at SFU... she really wants you to succeed. Took a class with her before and I just knew I had to take something with her again. Her classes are pretty easy to get an A in, but you HAVE to attend because she remembers people. She's extremely accommodating if you need anything too :)

Habiba was a really nice and accessible prof. Some of her criteria in the syllabus is unclear, and even after explaining it it's still not really clear, but otherwise good. Take-home final, paper marked very fairly (not too hard or too easy), and very approachable in office hours.
lectures outdated. lack of clarity for assignments
Very unclear in teacher.  Did not mark my papers fairly.  Participation is key but if she did not agree with what you said in comments I do not think she marked you well for participating.

Grading criteria is not clear. Most students had to ask the same questions over and over again in order for everyone to understand a little bit of what she wanted from us. Lecture is based on the summary of the articles of the week and her personal experience. Most articles and films are overtly out-dated. Films are over 10 years old. Stay away.

So passionate! I wasn't and still am not so into Development as a study topic, but I was majorly challenged by this class. Definitely worth taking - Habiba is a wonderful person--extremely kind and patient. I didn't love the course but I am so glad I did it.

Habiba is passionate about her subject and her students. She will challenge your thinking around racism, classism, and sexism. She isn't very clear about her standards for evaluating. Therefore, I strongly encourage students to follow her directions TO THE LETTER. Stick to it like glue so that you're at least in the range of a possible good grade.

Habiba is a very nice prof, she is very interested in the topic she was teaching. At times questions raised in class were not answered very clearly. Assignments were marked fairly I feel as long as you follow the guidelines she provides. Overall, I enjoyed the class!

I love her. She is very interested in what she teaches, and an intelligent woman. I take courses simply because she teaches them. Very approachable. Challenging tests and paper topics, but I love working hard because I know she does too.

Habiba made this class really interesting. I learned a lot from the interview exercise and thought the exercise really helped view women's economic status. Although she's not clear in what she askes for, I think it's another way for her to say that she's opened to ideas. Really easy professor and kind. Try not to take advantage of her though.

Habiba is very nice. You don't really need to copy down the notes since there is no final or midterm. I found her difficult to understand because of her accent. Overall a nice prof. Class wasn't too tough.

Habiba is sooooo nice but not a very effective instructor. The class was boring and she did not have a good handle on the students. Lectures were uninformative and rarely matched up with the readings. The class material was too broad and disconnected and the assignments were not useful. She is unclear about assignments and then marks hard.

i found she didn't supply enough information. she was repetitive, but when it came to projects and papers, she wasn't very clear on what she wanted. i found she didn't understand my questions, and rarely gave me a straight answer.

Very sweet woman, the class had a casual atmosphere which was good, however she did tend to repeat herself and the notes overlapped a lot too.  Reading the material wasn't really necessary for class discussion, the small class size helped facilitate discussion and we learned most of the material from notes, the lecture, examples and not from reading

Interesting and engaging professor however her notes tend to get mind-numbingly boring and tedious... most students did not even bother to read... many students chose to take advantage of her flexibility and her lack confidence in her teaching ability (she needs to be more assertive)...on the plus-side you get a much-needed alternative perspective
...have I made my points clear...lol!...

Habiba is very organized and thorough in her lectures...which by the way is one day for 4 hours straight! However, her notes are far toooo extensive and she is too repititious. Just get to the point and move on.
